description.para: If this parameter is set Samba no longer attempts to map DOS attributes like SYSTEM, HIDDEN, ARCHIVE or READ-ONLY to UNIX permission bits (such as the . Instead, DOS attributes will be stored onto an extended attribute in the UNIX filesystem, associated with the file or directory. For this to operate correctly, the parameters , , must be set to off. This parameter writes the DOS attributes as a string into the extended attribute named "user.DOSATTRIB". This extended attribute is explicitly hidden from smbd clients requesting an EA list. On Linux the filesystem must have been mounted with the mount option user_xattr in order for extended attributes to work, also extended attributes must be compiled into the Linux kernel.
